turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Trams in Osijek.
turn.1: What can you tell me about Trams in Osijek?
turn.2: Trams in Osijek The Osijek tram system is operated by the "City Transport of Osijek" (GPP Osijek) and serves the city of Osijek, capital of the Slavonia region of Croatia.
turn.3: Is there anything else important about the trams?
turn.4: The Osijek network is the only Croatian tram system still in existence outside Zagreb.
turn.5: When was the tram system first opened?
turn.6: Services have operated continuously since the first horse-car tram line was opened in 1884 (connecting the railway station and city square), and the first electric tram ran in 1926.
turn.7: Are the trams open to this day?
turn.8: The present network consists of two lines which intersect in the city square (Trg Anta Starčevića) and the fleet consists of refurbished Tatra T3 PVO vehicles and some newly acquired second hand DUEWAG GT6.
turn.9: Have there been any accidents or fatalities?
turn.10: During the Croatian War of Independence, five Tatra T3 streetcars were destroyed and two female drivers were killed in 1991/92.
turn.11: Are the trams used for special events?
turn.12: There is also an old Škoda tourist heritage tram, which can be rented for special occasions.
